## Main Objective

::: {.brand-triad-blue-red .bold-black style="text-align: center; padding-top: 150px;"}
Provide a solid introduction to R programming with a focus on [Tidyverse](https://tidyverse.org/) principles and its ecosystem
:::

::: {.notes}
- What to expect from the course.
:::

## Learning Objectives {.smaller}

1. Understand key concepts of computer science and programming
2. Learn the structure and essential components of R programming language
3. Learn tidyverse grammar for data manipulation
4. Learn grammar of graphics for data exploration and visualization
5. Learn tidymodels grammar for building statistical and predictive models

::: {style="padding-top: 15px;"}
[**Future courses?**]{.brand-triad-blue-red}

An Introduction to [Git](https://git-scm.com) and [GitHub](https://github.com)

An introduction to [Quarto](https://quarto.org/) and [Reproducible Workflows](https://open-science-training-handbook.gitbook.io/book/02opensciencebasics/04reproducibleresearchanddataanalysis)

An introduction to [Geospatial Data Science](https://r-spatial.org/book/) and the [r-spatial](https://r-spatial.org) framework

An introduction to [Shiny](https://shiny.posit.co) dashboards
:::

::: {.notes}
- Pre-course survey: discuss responses about future courses.
:::
